results.title: Nvidia Stock Drops on Report of Paused $100 Billion OpenAI Deal - Yahoo Finance
results.content:
The Wall Street Journal reported that discussions between Nvidia and OpenAI have slowed, citing people familiar with the matter. Nvidia had said in September it could invest up to $100 billion in the artificial intelligence company and help build large-scale computing capacity.

 Warning! GuruFocus has detected 5 Warning Signs with NVDA.
 Is NVDA fairly valued? Test your thesis with our free DCF calculator.

Chief Executive Jensen Huang later told industry contacts that the investment was not binding and had not been finalized, the report said. He also raised concerns about OpenAI's business approach and competition from companies such as Alphabet's Google (NASDAQ:GOOGL) and Anthropic. [...] ### New on Yahoo [...] ###

results.title: Nvidia Stock Forecast: Bracing for a Pullback Amid AI Headwinds - TipRanks
results.content:
## Financial Strength and Analyst Outlook

Nvidia posted 62% revenue growth to $57.01 billion in its October quarter, with net income up 65% to $31.91 billion. Analysts project fiscal 2026 revenue of over $212 billion, with AI spending set to rise 30% in 2026-2027. A projected $3 trillion global data center wave further cements long-term demand for GPUs.

## Is NVDA a Strong Buy?

Analysts remain highly optimistic about Nvidia’s long-term outlook. On TipRanks, NVDA stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 38 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell rating. The average Nvidia price target of $262.79 implies 37.5% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, NVDA stock has surged 63.8%.

See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue

1 [...] Sheryl ShethFeb 02, 2026, 07:17 PM

Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominance in artificial intelligence (AI) chips faces growing challenges that could weigh on its stock price in 2026. As the AI sector’s bellwether, Nvidia’s shares have dropped 7.6% over the past three months, outpacing the Nasdaq’s (NDX) 1.6% decline. Currently trading around $191, the stock has pulled back from its 52-week high of $212.

 Stay ahead of the market with  the latest news and analysis  and maximize your portfolio's potential

## Nvidia Stock Performance [...] ## Nvidia Stock Performance

Nvidia’s stock recently fell 0.72%, closing at $191.13 after hitting a daily low of $189.47. The company’s market cap stands at roughly $4.65 trillion, supported by high earnings per share (EPS) of $4.01 but an elevated price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 47.3x.

## Bearish Pressures vs. Growth Drivers

Rising costs for high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, essential for Nvidia’s GPUs (graphics processing units), are squeezing margins due to supply shortages. Nvidia faces heightened competition from Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and custom chips by hyperscalers like Alphabet’s (GOOGL) Google and Amazon (AMZN) threaten Nvidia’s 85% share of the AI accelerator market.

results.title: Can AI Demand Drive NVDA Stock To $240? - Forbes
results.content:
2022 Inflation Shock

 NVDA stock declined by 66.4% from a high of $33.38 on 29 November 2021 to $11.23 on 14 October 2022 compared to a peak-to-trough decrease of 25.4% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock fully rebounded to its pre-Crisis high by 25 May 2023
 Since then, the stock has climbed to a peak of $207.04 on 29 October 2025, and is currently trading at $185.61

2020 Covid Pandemic

 NVDA stock saw a drop of 37.6% from a peak of $7.87 on 19 February 2020 to $4.91 on 16 March 2020 compared to a peak-to-trough decline of 33.9% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock completely recovered to its pre-Crisis peak by 11 May 2020

2008 Global Financial Crisis [...] 2008 Global Financial Crisis

 NVDA stock fell by 85.1% from a high of $0.99 on 17 October 2007 to $0.15 on 20 November 2008 compared with a peak-to-trough decline of 56.8% for the S&P 500.
 But, the stock fully regained its pre-Crisis peak by 13 May 2016

However, the risk does not solely stem from major market downturns. Stocks can decline even when markets are performing well – think of events such as earnings reports, business updates, and outlook revisions. Review NVDA Dip Buyer Analyses to find out how the stock has bounced back from sharp declines in the past. [...] Subscribe: Less than $1.50/wk

results.title: Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne - The Motley Fool
results.content:
Nvidia (NVDA 2.82%) is, by far, the dominant maker of artificial intelligence (AI) chips and related technology. Indeed, the AI revolution is largely being fueled by the company's AI-enabling hardware, software, and tools.

So, when large companies in the AI space report powerful demand for their AI-related products, this is a positive for Nvidia. That's because these companies are almost always Nvidia partners and/or customers – directly or indirectly.

This is the case with both Palantir Technologies (PLTR +6.85%) and Teradyne (TER +13.35%), which both reported great fourth-quarter results after the market close on Monday. Both stocks had substantial gains on Tuesday.

Image source: Getty Images.

Beth McKenna is a contributing writer for The Motley Fool covering stocks and ETFs across various sectors, with a focus on artificial intelligence and emerging technologies.
